description: Dive into "Sun-Kissed Shores of Mumbai" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Sun-Kissed Shores of Mumbai

places.generalDescription: Aksa Beach, located in the western suburbs of Mumbai, is a popular destination for both locals and tourists. It offers a serene retreat from the bustling city life and boasts one of the longest coastlines in the area. Visitors can enjoy shallow waters, breathtaking sunsets, and a variety of street food vendors offering local delicacies like bhelpuri, pav bhaji, and South Indian dishes.

sources.snippet: This quiet and clean beach just minutes from Malad train station is one of the best getaways Northern Mumbai has to offer. Though swimming is mostly prohibited here, due to unpredictable currents and shifting sands, there‚Äôs plenty of space to sit back and gaze into the Arabian Sea. Though blissfully empty during weekdays, it attracts quite a few picnickers from the city‚Äôs Northern suburbs during the weekends.
sources.shortName: A Guide To The Best Beaches In And Around Mumbai

sources.snippet: Aksa Beach: Aksa Beach is a long drive from the city, but it's worth the journey. This beach is less crowded, offering an escape from the hustle and bustle of Mumbai. The wide stretch of sand is perfect for playing beach games or just lying down and enjoying the sun.
sources.shortName: Exploring beautiful beaches near Mumbai

sources.snippet: Set against the backdrop of swaying coconut trees, on the outskirts of the city in Malad, Aksa Beach is known for its clean sand and idyllic quietness, where all sorts of commercial activities take a backseat and peace becomes a state of mind. Walking barefoot on the soft sand during sunset is a must-do and the calming breeze gently adds to the tranquil surroundings. The beach serves as one of the best spots for organizing parties and picnics.
sources.shortName: 7 Best Beaches in Mumbai

sources.snippet: Just a little beyond the busy and crowded neighborhood of Malad lies a stunning little beach called Aksa. One of the few Mumbai beaches that are not commercialized, Aksa is a delightful stretch of sand where you can sit and enjoy the dazzling waters of the Arabian Sea without a care in the world. INS Hamla of the Indian Navy occupies one end of the beach and a uniformed guard monitors it (to stop you from venturing any further!).
sources.shortName: 8 Amazing Beaches in Mumbai for a Relaxing Weekend (2024)

sources.snippet: Aksa Beach is a popular short-distance getaway place for Mumbaikars. The nearby fishing villages are lined up with dozens of homestays and resorts for you to lay back and relax for the weekend. So if you‚Äôre tired of Mumbai house parties, where the houses are so cramped, half of the crowd moves to the balcony after 0.05 seconds into the party, then booking a villa by the Aksa Beach might be good for a change of mood and scenery.
sources.shortName: Beaches in Mumbai

sources.snippet: One of the cleanest beaches in Mumbai, the 'Aksa Beach' serves as one of the best spots for organizing parties and picnics. The 'Gorai Beach' is named after the village of 'Gorai' and is well-known for the local, coastal delicacies offered at the beach. So whether you want to go for a jog or you are just looking for a place to unwind, there is nothing better than heading out to one of Mumbai's popular beaches!
sources.shortName: Famous Beaches in Mumbai

sources.snippet: Not many had heard of this stunning beach until it got featured in a popular song that starred Salman Khan and Priyanka Chopra. Flanked by swaying coconut trees, Aksa beach in Malad serves as a sought-after weekend getaway for youngsters. The beach has lovely cottages and resorts, making it a nice place to enjoy a fun staycation with your loved ones.
sources.shortName: These Beaches In Mumbai Will Always Have Our Heart

sources.snippet: Aksa Beach, situated in Mumbai's Malad suburb, is a convenient one-hour drive from our hotel. Unlike its bustling counterparts, this beach is relatively less crowded and known for its golden sands, clear waters and relaxed ambience. However, do exercise caution while swimming here, as the strong waves make it unsuitable for inexperienced swimmers.
sources.shortName: Beaches to Visit in Mumbai

sources.snippet: This Beach is a popular beach and a vacation spot in Aksa village at Malad, Mumbai. It is one of the cleanest beaches in Mumbai and is located on the outskirts of the Western quarter of Malad. It is a popular weekend destination.Nearest Station: The nearest railway station to reach Aksa Beach is Malad Railway Station which is around 9 kilometres.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Mumbai to visit - Beaches

sources.snippet: Located a little on the outskirts of the city in Malad, Aksa Beach is an unparalleled oasis located close to Marve beach. The coastline is one of the longest in the city and offers an extremely vivid and surreal panorama of the merging horizon ahead. The beach, no doubt, owes most of its fame to the Bollywood song 'Tujhe Aksa Beach ghuma du'.
sources.shortName: 12 Best Beaches in Mumbai (2024)

sources.snippet: Aksa beach lies somewhere between Borivali and Malad at about 10 km from the respective stations. The secluded beach is very famous amongst the young couples as it is untouched by the visitors. The beach is unsafe to indulge into waters but if you want to take a long stroll along the coastline this place is all yours.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Beaches In Mumbai

sources.snippet: It's immaculately clean, making it a great spot to spend time with your partner and cherish the moment. The panoramic view of the coastline and the mesmerising sunset views makes it a favourite among couples. Set against the backdrop of coconut and palm trees, Aksa Beach is a peaceful location to spend the weekend.
sources.shortName: The 17 Best Beaches in Mumbai

sources.snippet: Located in Malad West, this is a place that is a favorite of the film industry. You will find the shooting films and TV serials happening quite often at this location. This beach is banned for swimming as there are spots where there is quicksand, and the beach has strong undercurrents making it dangerous to swim.
sources.shortName: Beaches of Mumbai - Mumbai beaches are better than GOA

sources.snippet: As one of the best beaches in Mumbai, Aksa Beach lies between Borivali and Malad famous for its idyllic quietness and clean sand. Due to not a lot of visitors, the beach gives a quiet and peaceful environment. It is a perfect place to enjoy the sunset with your closed one over here.
sources.shortName: A Guide to the Best Beaches in Mumbai, Weekend Getaways

sources.snippet: It is a popular destination in Malad, known for its scenic beauty and frequented by locals and tourists alike for leisure and relaxation. Offers various recreational activities such as water sports and picnics. It boasts stunning sunsets, making it a picturesque spot for visitors.
sources.shortName: 12 Famous Beaches in Mumbai You Must Visit

sources.snippet: Remember Salman Khan and Priyanka Chopra dancing on 'Tujhe Aksa Beach Ghuma Dun' in the movie God Tussi Great Ho?. Well, this is the beach they're talking about. With a backdrop of coconut trees and palm groves, the Aksa Beach in Malad is one of the quieter beaches in the city.
sources.shortName: Pretty Beaches In Mumbai To See I

sources.snippet: **Aksa Beach is one of the untouched beaches in the city, it is away from the chaos and hustle bustle. Here you can relax and come for a picnic. Aksa Beach is located in Malad which falls on the outskirts of the city and hence is a peaceful location to spend the weekend.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Breathtaking Beaches Of Mumbai

sources.snippet: Away from the commercialised jungle, Aksa Beach is located in a serene part of Mumbai. Here, you can spend hours in the company of your loved one without any disturbance. Walk on the vast stretch of sand or read a book while gazing upon the blue waters.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches to Visit in Mumbai

sources.snippet: Let‚Äôs start our list with one of the most popular beach in Mumbai which is included in one of our Bollywood songs ‚ÄúTujhe Aksa Beach Ghuma Dun Aa chalti kya?. ‚Äù One of cleanest beaches in Mumbai to view from a safe distance. How to Reach: Malad West
sources.shortName: 10 Best Beaches in Mumbai, Mumbai Beaches

sources.snippet: Remember the famous Salman Khan song, mentioning Aksa Beach?. Well, its unblemished beauty is worth mentioning. This shimmering and powdery stretch of sand is a tranquil escape from the bustling sounds of the city.
sources.shortName: Top 15 Soul Soothing Beaches in Mumbai

sources.snippet: The weather here is beautiful and by evening the climate gets better. The cool rolling waters are so mesmerizing to look at. It is a great place for a short tour with family and friends.
sources.shortName: 9 Best Beaches in Mumbai with Pictures

sources.snippet: Aksa Beach is a popular beach and a vacation spot in Aksa village in Malad, Mumbai, India. It is situated close to Marve Beach. It is a popular weekend destination.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Beaches Of Mumbai That Makes Everyone Love It

sources.snippet: The specialty of Aksa Beach is that the crowd is very less here. Which is very comforting for any loving couple. Aksa Beach is also known as Lovers Point.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Mumbai - How to Reach, Things to Do, All Guide

places.name: Aksa Beach

reviews.text: Wonderful beach. Usually a less crowded area. I will suggest going between 0530-0630pm or 0550-0640am for the nicest view. You will get plenty of space if you are planning to play football.

Clean beach, however approach road is under construction nowdays.
However traffic police manages everything perfectly.
Paid parking available at 70rs per 6 hours.
Peaceful and breezy spot in the middle of the city chaos. Aksa Beach is clean, calm, and perfect for a relaxing walk. Great place to unwind, especially during sunrise

places.generalDescription: Marine Drive is a 3.6-km long promenade that runs along the natural bay in Mumbai, adorned with art deco-style buildings and restaurants. It is known for its stunning collection of Art Deco architecture, showcasing some of the most expensive real estate in India. The ocean-facing apartment buildings offer breathtaking views and are highly sought after, with prices reaching upwards of $1500 per square foot.

sources.snippet: Marine Drive (officially, "Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose Road") is a 3km long, six lane concrete road in southern Mumbai which stretches north along the coastline, forming a natural bay. This C-shaped road links Nariman Point to Babulnath, and is situated at the foot of Malabar Hill. Known world over as Marine Drive, this tourist spot has also been called Sonapur by the locals of the city.
sources.shortName: Famous Beaches in Mumbai

sources.snippet: Starting from the north of Nariman Point and ending at the famous Chowpatty beach, the Marine Drive is a 3 km long arc-shaped road along the seacoast of South Mumbai. It is regarded as the best place to watch the sunset in Mumbai. Not technically a beach, it is actually a favourite waterside hangout spot for Mumbaikars.
sources.shortName: 12 Best Beaches in Mumbai (2024)

sources.snippet: You will also see Wankhede Stadium near this Marine Drive beach. Nariman Point or Marine Drive is also a lover's point. Marine Drive Beach is also very quiet.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Mumbai - How to Reach, Things to Do, All Guide

places.name: Marine Dr

reviews.text: Beautiful place, definitely visit. Try to go evening time and just enjoy the weather. Lovely fresh air from Arabian Sea.
Really peaceful atmosphere especially on a windy evening time. Lots of people spend their evening at this side. The wind have a very calming effect on everyone

Love this place ü§©üòÄ...Mood fresh ü§©
Marine drive Mumbai ü•∞üòò
I like this place.

Superb view

places.generalDescription: Silver Beach, nestled in Juhu, Mumbai, is a stunning coastal retreat that offers a tranquil escape from the bustling city life. This beautiful beach stretches along the Arabian Sea and is perfect for leisurely strolls while soaking in serene views. Known for its cleanliness and peaceful atmosphere, Silver Beach attracts both locals and tourists seeking relaxation or family outings. Visitors can indulge in delicious street food like pani puri and pav bhaji while enjoying breathtaking sunsets over the horizon.

sources.snippet: Silver Beach in Juhu, Mumbai, is renowned for its picturesque beauty. Stretching along the Arabian Sea coast, it attracts locals and tourists. The beach offers serene views, perfect for relaxation and strolls.
sources.shortName: 12 Famous Beaches in Mumbai You Must Visit

places.name: Silver Beach

reviews.text: It has one of the best beaches in mumbai. Clean friendly environment and much better view. During monsoon it can get a little dirty near the coast lines but it gets cleaned so there should be no problem faced by people. The poles reflect lights which say swach Bharat which is a great initiative to bring more cleanliness to the beach. I love how the people are also very cooperative and friendly not rude at all. Overall a good place to spend time with your date, family, friends etc. I go there daily so cheers if you find me.

Visiting Silver Beach was an interesting experience üáÆüá≥üåä. As someone used to the white sands and clear waters of South African beaches üáøüá¶üèñÔ∏è, I found the beach here quite different - the sand was darker, and the water had a brownish hue, which might surprise first-time visitors.

That said, it's clear that Silver Beach holds local charm and significance üåÖüë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶. The atmosphere was lively, with families, friends, and children enjoying the space in their own way - whether walking, playing, or simply relaxing. There's a genuine sense of community here, and that in itself was beautiful to see ‚ù§Ô∏èü™∑.

For future improvement, perhaps a focus on beach cleanliness, waste management, and better facilities would really elevate the experience üå±üöÆ. Even small steps could help preserve and celebrate this natural space, not just for locals but for visitors from across the country and abroad üåçüôèüèæ.

(Every beach has its own story.) üåäüìñ

A peaceful and refreshing spot!
Silver Beach is quite a good place to relax with friends or family. The beach is clean and well-maintained, making it perfect for spending a few calm hours. You can bring your own mat, sit back, and enjoy the soothing sea breeze while watching the sunset, it's truly beautiful. Ideal for a peaceful evening away from the city noise. Highly recommended for a chill outing!

places.address: 2, JVPD Scheme, Juhu, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400049, India

places.generalDescription: Gorai Beach, nestled in the Gorai creek near Essel World, is a popular day-trip destination for locals. Known for its cleanliness and serenity, it offers a unique blend of calmness and beauty along the Arabian Sea. The beach boasts numerous food shacks, street food stalls, and resorts with beach houses. Adventure enthusiasts can indulge in camel rides and boat rides while others can enjoy water sports or simply relax amidst tall coconut trees.

sources.snippet: Gorai Beach: To reach Gorai Beach, you'll need to take a ferry from Borivali. The short boat ride adds an element of adventure to your beach day. Gorai Beach is known for its clean surroundings and is a popular picnic spot.
sources.shortName: Exploring beautiful beaches near Mumbai

sources.snippet: **Gorai Beach is located in Borivali and the beach is surrounded all over with tall coconut trees and loved by the locals. In the evening, while you are waiting for the sunset you can munch of some good healthy snacks like Bhutta (Roasted corn), Chanajor Garam, a tasty little snack made by adding raw mango and some tomatoes and onion sprinkles. During Ganesh Chaturthi, people come here from Visarjan which is the immersion of Ganesh Idols in the sea water.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Breathtaking Beaches Of Mumbai

sources.snippet: Calm and soothing vibes welcome you to Gorai Beach, located at the northern end of Mumbai. Despite being one of the most frequented beaches in Mumbai, Gorai is still untouched by the rampant crowds you‚Äôll see at other beaches in the city. Except for some shack-style establishments that sell beach gear like shorts and sandals or light snacks, there aren‚Äôt many shops here.
sources.shortName: 8 Amazing Beaches in Mumbai for a Relaxing Weekend (2024)

sources.snippet: This is one of the cleanest and safest beach in Mumbai Gorai beach is at a distance of 40 km from the city of Mumbai. There are several cottages and resorts available for overnight stay. it offers an ideal relaxing destination to spend the weekend.Nearest Station: Nearest Railway station to reach Gorai Beach is Malad and Borivali station.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Mumbai to visit - Beaches

sources.snippet: Gorai Beach is one of the most frequented beaches near Mumbai. Located near Bhayandar, on the Gorai Creek, the soothing calmness of this beach makes for a perfect weekend getaway spot from Mumbai. Other than the few food shacks and street food options available at the spot, the beach is also home to nearby resorts and beach houses.
sources.shortName: 12 Best Beaches in Mumbai (2024)

sources.snippet: With the calming waves, the stunning views, and local fast-food stalls, it's a great destination to spend time with friends. It's among the most popular beaches in north Mumbai. You can indulge in freshly-cooked fish and seafood dishes, try local snacks or go for horse rides across the beach.
sources.shortName: The 17 Best Beaches in Mumbai

sources.snippet: Few beaches in Mumbai are as quiet and untouched by huge crowds as Gorai Beach. Located on the northern end of Mumbai, it‚Äôs a perfect place for picnics and long walks along the constantly moving waves. But if walking is not your thing, Gorai Beach also offers horseback riding in the sands.
sources.shortName: Beaches in Mumbai

sources.snippet: The 'Gorai Beach' is named after the village of 'Gorai' and is well-known for the local, coastal delicacies offered at the beach. So whether you want to go for a jog or you are just looking for a place to unwind, there is nothing better than heading out to one of Mumbai's popular beaches!
sources.shortName: Famous Beaches in Mumbai

sources.snippet: Extremely popular for its sunrise and sunsets and especially among youngsters, it is one of the most peaceful beaches in Mumbai. You could easily take a ferry from Borivali or Malad to reach here. There is also a seafood market where you can find some delicious things to eat.
sources.shortName: A Guide to the Best Beaches in Mumbai, Weekend Getaways

sources.snippet: It is known for its picturesque landscapes and serene atmosphere. It offers various water sports activities and beachside entertainment. Famous for its stunning sunsets and calming ocean waves, it is ideal for leisurely walks along the sandy coastline.
sources.shortName: 12 Famous Beaches in Mumbai You Must Visit

sources.snippet: If you are visiting Mumbai for the first time, there is no dearth of things you can explore around the city. Of late, Mumbai has been renovated by many new construction projects and leisure zones. One such popular tourist spot is Gorai Beach.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Beaches Of Mumbai That Makes Everyone Love It

sources.snippet: Located on the outskirts of Mumbai, Gorai Beach is famous among youngsters. The beach hosts some of the best and most happening night parties. When here, you can also enjoy jet skiing, kite surfing, and other interesting water sports.
sources.shortName: These Beaches In Mumbai Will Always Have Our Heart

sources.snippet: A ferry ride away from Malad or Borivali, this beach is among the most beautiful stretches of sand. Brimming with seashells, snails, the calming sound of the sea waves, and the stunning views, Gorai Beach will be a delight for you.
sources.shortName: Top 15 Soul Soothing Beaches in Mumbai

sources.snippet: Due to its proximity to the Gorai village, the beach can be found with many locals with sea food. Must Read: romantic places near mumbai for couples one day. How to Reach: Dharavi Bhet Ferry rides from Borivali or from Bhayander
sources.shortName: 10 Best Beaches in Mumbai, Mumbai Beaches

sources.snippet: Gorai beach lies towards the north-east of the city adjoining the Gorai village. The beach is popular for its beautiful sunrises and sunsets. The local sea-food market is also famous next to this beach.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Beaches In Mumbai

sources.snippet: You can take a cottage for a single night, and it will cost you around Rs.1200. It is a beautiful place with a beach where you can swim. This is considered to be a safe beach to swim in.
sources.shortName: Beaches of Mumbai - Mumbai beaches are better than GOA

sources.snippet: Because the depth of the sea of ‚Äã‚Äãthis Gorai Beach is very low. You can go swimming in the sea without any problem. The water at this Gorai Beach is slightly muddy.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Mumbai - How to Reach, Things to Do, All Guide

places.name: Gorai Beach

reviews.text:
The Beach is nearby from Borivali West
There are 2 ways to go this place
By Road from Mira Bhayander and by ferry

In ferry Only two wheeler bikes are allowed
Total costing for bike in ferry is rs 5/-
Ticket at jetty per person is rs 20/- each

On the beach there are now various activities to be like
Atv ride
Horse ride
Banana boat
Jetsi

We took the atv ride which costed us around 150/-

Food stalls are available on the beach
No parking issues here as the only problem you will face the entrance of Gorai is narrow and most of the cars gets stuck due to traffic

Washroom is not there on beach
You can go to restaurant or resorts as they provide washroom facilities

For sunset this beach is good to enjoy and chill

The usual beach üèñÔ∏è case scenario like any other beach. The approach road to reach the beach is too narrow. So narrow that only one vehicle can pass at a time & road itself causes Traffic Jam. The beac soil is black. You can find Caf√©s & Sea food eateries nearby.
The water is dirty.
Go here if you want to enjoy sunset üåá with waves..

Gorai Beach is decent if you're looking for a quick escape from city life. It's relatively cleaner than some other Mumbai beaches, but weekends can get quite crowded. Best to go on a weekday. The horse rides and ATV bikes add some fun for kids. It could be better maintained, but overall, a good experience.

sources.snippet: A short drive away from Aksa is a smaller beach that has a rock-lined entrance, and a beautiful promenade that is usually filled with people there to enjoy the sunset. A well-known beach with a smaller strip of sand but lovely none the less!. You're promised a dramatically pretty sky, lots of quiet corners to relax in, and ample parking space, which is frankly a miracle in this specific part of town.
sources.shortName: Pretty Beaches In Mumbai To See I

sources.snippet: It's close to the city, just by Aksa Beach, and it isn't too crowded. Not a lot of tourists visit the place. It's one of the isolated beaches in Mumbai, where you can spend time looking at the setting sun and munching at fries.
sources.shortName: The 17 Best Beaches in Mumbai

sources.snippet: Dana Pani Beach is a popular destination in Malad West, Mumbai. With its pristine shoreline and scenic beauty, it attracts locals and tourists alike. The beach offers a tranquil escape from the bustling city life.
sources.shortName: 12 Famous Beaches in Mumbai You Must Visit

reviews.text:
It was a hidden beach but now has turn into a popular beach in munbaikars .
A kilometre ahead of Aksa beach ,clean,calm and neat beach not that overcrowded and no stalls and vendors like Aksa beach .
Weekend time you will get to see people enjoying their time with hard drinks as you go towards end of beach .
Roads leading to this beach was beautiful but road repairs and dust storms is making it worse to drive .
As you enter the last road and end the curve the scenery is just like Konkan road , superb !

Dana Pani Beach offers a serene escape from Mumbai's relentless chaos. With its tranquil ambiance, breathtaking views, and uncrowded spaces perfect for relaxation or activities, it stands out as a refreshing retreat. However, the lack of proper maintenance and inadequate waste management detracts from its true potential.

Place is good and at some point clean but it's too far from the railway to travel. You can take a alternative root from uttan to Morway an then a boot. Other than that it's a good place also for couple.

places.generalDescription: Girgaon Chowpatty is a no-frills beach in Mumbai where locals gather to immerse Lord Ganesh idols during the Ganesh Visarjan festival. It's renowned for its delectable street food, offering iconic dishes like Vada Pav, Pav Bhaji, Pani Puri, and Bhelpuri. The beach is a popular spot for enjoying the crashing waves and indulging in mouth-watering snacks from food stalls.

sources.snippet: Girgaum Chowpatty is a famous beachside location that is popular for its snack stalls. There‚Äôs a lot you can do around the place with your better half. From visiting the temple nearby to heading over to the historic Gateway of India, there are plenty of things you can do together.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Beaches Of Mumbai That Makes Everyone Love It
12 Famous Beaches in Mumbai You Must Visit

places.name: Girgaon Chowpatty

reviews.text: Girgaon Chowpatty is a lively Mumbai beach famous for sunsets, street food like bhel puri and pav bhaji, and festive vibes during Ganesh Visarjan. It's not ideal for swimming due to pollution, but perfect for evening strolls and local flavor.
Best for evening time. But sea water is too dirty.. Need to maintain beach well. Here best food stalls and icecream stalls are available.

Girgaon Chowpatty is located where the marine drive ends. While entering we shall find various vendors selling snacks on the left side while the sea is good 100 meters away from the enterance. It is good for strolling and walking. The beach is not ideal for swimming but one can sit here to step away from hustle and bustle of adjoining areas. Ideally you can spend good time here.

places.generalDescription: Dadar Chowpatty, also known as Dadar Beach, is a versatile destination just a short drive from the city center of Mumbai. It offers opportunities for swimming, sunbathing, and picnicking against the backdrop of the Arabian Sea. The beach is surrounded by cultural landmarks such as the Dadar Parsi Colony and Shree Siddhivinayak Ganapati Temple.

sources.snippet: A mere 30-minute drive from our hotel, Dadar Chowpatty is a hub for swimming, sunbathing and picnicking, making it a versatile destination. Surrounding it are notable cultural landmarks, including the Dadar Parsi Colony, a UNESCO World Heritage Site and Shree Siddhivinayak Ganapati Temple, a renowned Mumbai temple. As the day winds down, Dadar Chowpatty transforms into a sunset haven, with its promenade hosting lively street performers who captivate visitors with music, dance and acrobatics.
sources.shortName: Beaches to Visit in Mumbai

sources.snippet: As the name suggests, Dadar Chowpatty Beach is situated in the Dadar suburbs of Mumbai. Majorly popular for the giant view of the Bandra Worli Sea Link bridge, this beach is customarily used for jogging and watching beautiful sunsets. Located in South Bombay, the beach is frequented by locals coming for an evening stroll, early morning yoga or to spend some leisure time.
sources.shortName: 12 Best Beaches in Mumbai (2024)

sources.snippet: The beach is usually less crowded because the sand in the area is less making it difficult to sit and have a view of the Arabian Sea. The beach is ideally used jogging and watching sunsets though. Apart from the natural sea beach, it offers a wonderful and grand view of Bandra Worli Sea Link Bridge.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Mumbai to visit - Beaches

sources.snippet: Again laying in South Mumbai,  Dadar Chowpatty beach this beach is very close to Dadar Station. The beach is usually less crowded because the sand in the area is less making it difficult to sit and have a view of the Arabian Sea. The beach is ideally used jogging and watching sunsets though.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Beaches In Mumbai

sources.snippet: ** The best view from Dadar Chowpatty is of the stretch of the giant Bandra Worli Sea Link. The sunsets and evenings at Dadar Chowpatty are absolutely mystical!. The entire Bandra Worli Sea Link is lit up beautifully in the evening!.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Breathtaking Beaches Of Mumbai

sources.snippet: This bustling beach is often visited for the incredible view of the Bandra-Worli sea link. Located in Dadar, this beach is a favourite among fitness freaks. You‚Äôll come across locals enjoying a morning run or an evening stroll.
sources.shortName: These Beaches In Mumbai Will Always Have Our Heart

sources.snippet: Dadar Chowpatty Beach is one of the lesser-known beaches in Mumbai. People visit this quaint beach for their evening strolls and jogs. It's an ideal location to see the dawn and dusk over the bustling cityscape.
sources.shortName: The 17 Best Beaches in Mumbai

sources.snippet: Dadar Chowpatty is a bustling food destination in Mumbai city. It offers a variety of street food delicacies and snacks. Visitors enjoy the vibrant atmosphere and scenic waterfront views.
sources.shortName: 12 Famous Beaches in Mumbai You Must Visit

sources.snippet: Another in the south, Dadar chowpatty beach is a very quiet beach, but in the early mornings are crowded by frequent joggers and sunset lovers.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Beaches in Mumbai, Mumbai Beaches

places.name: Dadar Chowpatty

reviews.text: It's a perfect place for a peaceful evening. They have a whole sitting area above the beach. You can spend a good time there while enjoying the sunset and clicking photos. You can also go to the beach as well using the way besides the sitting area. It has many stalls for pav bhaji, bhelpuri and of course the obvious corn on the cob and gola.

Great Worli sea link view and not as crowded as other beaches.
The beach isn't that good but the viewing point is very well maintained.
Best for sunset view.

Dadar Chowpatty ‚Äì Quick Review (in Simple Words):
How to Reach:
Just 10 minutes walk from Dadar railway station (west side).

Main Attractions:
‚Ä¢	Sea view with a breeze and open sky
‚Ä¢	Chaitya Bhoomi ‚Äì Memorial of Dr. B.R. Ambedkar - The chief architect of the Indian Constitution and a champion of social justice and equality.
‚Ä¢	Narali Baug ‚Äì A small garden nearby
‚Ä¢	Wooden deck ‚Äì Built in 2019, great for sea views and photos
‚Ä¢	View of Worli Sea Link ‚Äì Looks beautiful, especially at sunrise and sunset

Things to Know:
‚Ä¢	Beach has become very small due to construction work
‚Ä¢	Not very clean ‚Äì not suitable for kids to play
‚Ä¢	Better beach options: Girgauv Chowpatty or Juhu Beach for cleaner and bigger areas
‚Ä¢	Beware: Horses often run along the beach area - stay alert, especially with kids or elderly.

places.generalDescription: Versova Beach, located in the western suburbs of Mumbai, is a quieter alternative to the bustling Juhu Beach. It offers swimmable waters and breathtaking sunset views over the Arabian Sea. The beach is known for its clean sandy and rocky landscape and is popular among couples and youngsters seeking solace away from city life. Versova Beach also features a colorful fishing village with a vibrant fish market, making it an ideal spot for relaxation and enjoying mesmerizing sunsets.

sources.snippet: Versova Beach: Versova Beach is known for its peaceful atmosphere. It's less crowded compared to other beaches, making it an ideal place to go. You might even find some local fishermen at work.
sources.shortName: Exploring beautiful beaches near Mumbai

sources.snippet: A 20-minute drive from our hotel will take you to Versova Beach, one of the cleanest beaches in Mumbai which is known for its white sand, clear waters and rocky coastline. This beach, adorned with charming Koli fishing villages, is perfect for swimming, sunbathing and leisurely strolls. Along its promenade, food stalls and restaurants serve delightful local delicacies, while evenings here are a visual treat with sunsets over the Arabian Sea, making Versova Beach one of the best beaches in Mumbai to visit for tourists and locals alike.
sources.shortName: Beaches to Visit in Mumbai

sources.snippet: At the northern end of Juhu is Versova Beach, a quieter arc of sand that adjoins a fishing village of the same name. One of the loveliest beaches in Mumbai, Versova is known for its swimmable waters, the colorful fishing boats, and its breathtaking views of the sun setting into the Arabian Sea. Populated mostly by couples and youngsters, Versova Beach is a mix of sandy and rocky landscape and considered one of the cleanest beaches in Mumbai.

sources.snippet: A continuation of Juhu Beach towards the Andheri suburbs, Versova Beach is comparatively less crowded and only separated by a creek from the former beach. Versova is essentially a fishing village inhabited by Kolis (fisherfolks) situated in the vicinity of the beach and is a hotbed for fish trade. The beach is rather small but is extremely popular for the humongous fish market and the fish auctions held at the spot on a daily basis.
sources.shortName: 12 Best Beaches in Mumbai (2024)

sources.snippet: The Versova Beach is one of the other popular family beaches located in Mumbai and is comparatively less crowded. sources.snippet: One of the cleanest beaches in Mumbai, Versova Beach largely remains untrammelled by overcrowding. I recently visited this rocky beach, and I must say, it left quite an impression. The beach itself was clean, though it tends to get quite crowded on weekends and holidays. The entry is rather narrow, which can be a bit of a squeeze during peak times. As I walked along the shoreline, I couldn't help but notice the stunning, high-profile bungalows dotting the area, adding a sense of luxury to the surroundings. It's a lovely spot to unwind, whether you're with a companion or a group of friends. Watching the sunset here was truly mesmerizing and definitely worth experiencing.

Madh is a serene and picturesque destination, surrounded by lush greenery and filled with warm, welcoming people. The food here is delightful, and the air is refreshingly clean-making it a perfect retreat for those seeking a healthy, rejuvenating experience. While traveling to Madh might require a bit of effort, the journey is more than worth it. Once you're here, you'll find yourself captivated by its tranquil environment and natural beauty, ensuring there's never a dull moment. A visit to Madh is truly a refreshing escape from the chaos of everyday life.

places.generalDescription: Marine Drive Beach, located in the southern part of Mumbai, spans about 3 kilometers and is a beloved destination for tourists. The beach is renowned for its stunning waters, pleasant weather, and expansive sandy shores that are perfect for leisurely barefoot strolls. Known as the Queen's Necklace due to its C-shaped layout that resembles a string of pearls when illuminated at night, this picturesque spot offers an ideal setting for relaxation and introspection.

sources.snippet: The Marine Drive Beach is about three kilometers long and is located in the south of Mumbai. It is a popular tourist spot and is known for its sparkling beautiful waters, balmy weather and cool stretches of sand. places.name: Marine drive beach

reviews.text:
*A Scenic Gem in the Heart of Mumbai!*

"Marine Drive Beach, also known as Queen's Necklace, is a stunning stretch of coastline that offers breathtaking views of the Arabian Sea. This iconic destination is a must-visit for anyone in Mumbai.

*Pros:*

- Breathtaking sunsets and sunrises
- Scenic views of the city skyline
- Romantic evening strolls
- Vibrant atmosphere, especially during festivals
- Access to nearby restaurants, cafes, and shops

*Cons:*

- Crowded and noisy, especially on weekends
- Limited parking options
- Not ideal for swimming due to strong currents

*Experience:*

Take a leisurely walk along the promenade, feel the sea breeze, and enjoy the street food. Visit during sunset for an unforgettable experience. The twinkling city lights at night are a sight to behold.

*Tips:*

- Visit early morning or late evening for a peaceful experience
- Be cautious of strong currents and avoid swimming
- Try the local street food, like chaat and pav bhaji

*Recommendation:* A must-visit for couples, families, and solo travelers seeking a scenic and vibrant experience.

Had a long day of work?had a stress at school/college? Just come here and who who came to Mumbai for the first time try out once man you gonna love it to your core .come after 5.30.its obviously gonna be crowded. But just find somewhere to sit. Put your earbuds , find some slow songs.boom you gonna feel the bliss, The melting of all your stress and anxiety.The cold wind touching your skin , Bhai itna sukoon you can sit all that night doing nothing. Just relax and fresh up your mind. The peace everyone deserves every once in a while.

Heaven in Mumbai beautiful place sit for while feel relaxed. One of the most beautiful place in my life where I feel relaxed. Marine Drive is a 3.6-kilometre-long road in South Mumbai in the city of Mumbai. The road was constructed by late philanthropist Bhagojisheth Keer and Pallonji Mistry. It is a  C shaped also known as the Queen's Necklace because, when viewed at night from an elevated point anywhere along the¬†drive .marine drive link Nariman Point to Babulnath and Malabar Hill.

places.generalDescription: Manori Beach, situated near Marve Beach in Mumbai, is a pristine and serene getaway surrounded by cashew nut groves and charming Portuguese architecture. It's a popular spot for families and night parties, with easy access to Essel World via ferry. The area boasts splendid Portuguese architecture and a local church where you can experience Sunday mass. Accessible from Malad and Borivali stations, the beach offers a clean environment with lush greenery on one side and the beautiful sea on the other.

places.name: Marv√© Beach

reviews.text:
Marve Beach, nestled in the western suburbs of Mumbai, offers a refreshing escape from the bustling city life. This picturesque beach, located in Malad West, is a hidden gem that attracts both locals and tourists seeking tranquility and natural beauty.
The beach boasts a serene atmosphere, with soft golden sands stretching along the Arabian Sea. The calm waters and gentle waves make it an ideal spot for relaxation and rejuvenation. The scenic beauty of the surrounding area, with lush greenery and charming coastal villas, adds to the overall charm of Marve Beach.
One of the highlights of Marve Beach is the stunning sunset. As the sun dips below the horizon, the sky is painted with vibrant hues of orange, pink, and purple, creating a breathtaking spectacle. Many visitors gather on the beach to witness this awe-inspiring natural phenomenon.
While swimming is not recommended due to strong currents, visitors can enjoy other activities such as beachcombing, sunbathing, and leisurely walks along the shoreline. The beach also offers opportunities for water sports like kayaking and paddleboarding, adding an element of adventure to the experience.
For those seeking a more cultural experience, Marve Beach is home to a small Portuguese church, adding a touch of history to the coastal landscape. The beach is also a popular spot for photography enthusiasts, capturing the serene beauty of the surroundings.
However, it's important to note that Marve Beach can get crowded during weekends and holidays. Additionally, the cleanliness of the beach can vary, so it's advisable to visit during weekdays or early mornings to enjoy a more peaceful experience.
Overall, Marve Beach is a delightful escape from the urban chaos of Mumbai. Its serene ambiance, stunning sunsets, and natural beauty make it a perfect destination for those seeking a tranquil and rejuvenating experience.

sources.snippet: Situated at the end of Navi Mumbai, Uran lies in the Konkan division between Panvel and Karjat. Primarily a tiny fishing and agriculture village, Uran has several beaches to its attribute - the most popular of which are Pirvad, Mankeshwar and ONGC. Pirvad is the most frequented beach, with plenty of tourists visiting it every day.

sources.snippet: Surrounded by the sea on three sides, Uran beach is a hidden gem to get away from the urban land. Soak in the sun, witness the mesmerising surroundings, or sit back and relax on the shimmering sand. This beautiful beach in Mumbai is exactly where you want to be if you are looking for some down time.

sources.snippet: It is a sort of fishing village situated at the end of Navi Mumbai flanked by the sea at three sides. sources.shortName: 10 Best Beaches in Mumbai, Mumbai Beaches

places.name: Uran Beach

reviews.text:
Visited Uran Beach on April 22 during the peak summer season for a relaxing day with friends-and it turned out to be a great experience! Rated 4.5/5 stars.

The beach was clean, peaceful, and not crowded, which made it perfect for swimming and relaxing. We swam from 1 PM to 6 PM, and the changing tide levels throughout the day added to the experience. Around 1 PM, the water was shallow and far from the rocks, but by 5‚Äì6 PM, the waves had risen and started hitting the stones at the edge of the beach. Sitting on those rocks and feeling the waves crash against me was just an amazing feeling.

Just a heads-up-the water is extremely salty. I had a bit of discomfort in my eyes, and even got a slight ear infection, but it's all fine now after a doctor visit.

We carried biryani, had a mini picnic in the evening, and responsibly cleaned the area before leaving. There were a few local food stalls nearby too.

It's a great spot for photography, family outings, or just peace of mind.

Tips for first-time visitors:

Avoid going deep if you don't know how to swim.

Carry your own food and water-but please clean up afterward.

Best time to visit is early morning or late afternoon to avoid harsh heat.

The tide level rises in the evening, so plan your swim time accordingly.

Don't forget sunscreen and sunglasses!

Uran Beach is a hidden gem just a two-hour drive from Kalyan! It's the perfect getaway for anyone looking to unwind and enjoy some natural beauty. The beach is absolutely stunning, especially during sunset-definitely a sight to behold!

Just a heads up, there are no washroom facilities available, so plan accordingly. Overall, it's a serene spot that I highly recommend for a peaceful day by the sea! Enjoy your visit!

Relaxing and peaceful destination with clean shores and a serene atmosphere. The best time to visit is in the morning for a calm and refreshing experience or in the evening to witness a breathtaking sunset. The soothing waves and fresh sea breeze make it a perfect spot to unwind and enjoy nature.

places.address: VW8F+H48, Kathe Aali, Nagaon, Uran, Navi Mumbai, Maharashtra 400702, India

places.generalDescription: A beautiful and relaxing beach with crystal clear waters, Manori Beach is a popular spot for fishing and swimming. The beach is also home to restaurants and beach huts serving seafood and snacks. Sundays are a busy time at the church located nearby, attracting tourists from all over Maharashtra.

sources.snippet: Are you looking for the most romantic place to go with your partner?. Then Manori beach is the best place in Mumbai. This is a hidden gem when it comes to beaches.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Beaches Of Mumbai That Makes Everyone Love It

places.name: Manori Beach

reviews.text:
If you want to see a secluded and clean beach then this is it. Whenever I have come here I have always found no one out here and this place looks beautiful, as there is a hill side view of the sea & looks serene.

You can sit here and fall in awe of the place and pictures do not do justice to the beauty of this place. You can visit this place by any mode of transport and take your vehicle to a certain and make a small climb to experience this calm and breezy location.

Be sure to come in the daylight and in a group since this place is so secluded.

Very nice beach, visited on 31st July 2021 and there were absolutely no one on the beach we have enjoyed clicked photos and  sat for more than 2 hours
While traveling you can either take your own food or get packed from nearby village as there are no shops on beach.
Also before actual spot(Manori Beach) you will see a random beach (a rock beach) visit there as well as it beautiful and very peaceful.
Just be cautious about stones and shells otherwise really pretty.
It's a best place for the relaxation. Very chilled weather. I loved this place.
